title: python
description: Some of my favorite Python features are [list/dict/set] comprehensions and generator expressions for their elegance. I also really love that well-written, clean code is a priority for the language.

title: pytest
description: I love Pytest's functional approach, the clear test results formatting, and its fixtures.

title: flask
description: What's not to love? You can get a Flask API up and running fairly quickly and writing view functions feels pretty intuitive for me.

title: html
description: Fun fact - I started messing around with HTML when I got a tumblr in high school! I love how accessibility is a big part of HTML and it's been fun learning about head tags for search engine optimization (SEO).

title: css
description: As an artist, I really appreciate nice visuals and good design, so I always have fun styling a website with CSS. I have especially enjoyed messing around with animations and transitions as I have been working on this portfolio site.

title: javascript
description: I have a love/hate relationship with JavaScript, but I never get tired of event listeners. There is something very satisfying about triggering and handling events.

title: react
description: I really love React! Working with component-based elements makes the development process so nice!

title: sqlalchemy
description: While the documentation for SQLAlchemy is a bit of a pain, it is really nice handing off database queries to an object relational mapper (ORM).

title: sql
description: I find it fascinating how simple the syntax is for SQL and yet it is so powerful as a language. My favorite functionality is probably joins.

title: postgresql
description: PostgreSQL is great and I love that it's open source.

title: ansible
description: I am really impressed with how easy it is to do things like navigate around an operating system, check file permissions, and automate the execution of scripts with Ansible.

title: jenkins
description: I really enjoy creating continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines with Jenkins. It's nice seeing all of the aggregated data in one place and I also enjoy the built in secrets management.

title: docker
description: What's not to love about Docker? Being able to reproduce an environment with lightweight Docker Containers is great for so many reasons, but especially deployments.

title: git
description: I have used git professionally with GitHub and GitLab. It's just an all around great tool.

title: c++
description: While C++ is by no means a language I choose to develop with often, I do appreciate the more granular levels of control it gives developers due to it being statically typed and things like its manual memory management.

title: java
description: Java is another language  I have not used too much, but I enjoy that its statically typed and I recognize its power. So, I would be happy to spend some more time working with Java in the future.

title: render
description: Render's free tier is pretty solid. It has some bugs, but overall I think it's a decent service.

title: heroku
description: I really enjoyed deployments with Heroku, but I'm sad they got rid of their free tier.

title: robot framework
description: This testing framework is super unique and I'm intrigued by their plain English approach to tests. It was fun working with this one!
